Posts.Content: Jul 13, 2011 04:08PM smhuse wrote: Thank you so much for your replies.  I did have an upper GI, which showed mild GERD, but it hasn't stopped the bloatng, sense of fullness, or uncomfortable feelings that make it somewhat more difficult to breathe. I will see my oncologist on Friday (1st appt) and I will try to ask about this at that time. Susan
Posts.Title: Cervical Cancer related to BC? smhuse smhuse

Posts.Content: Jul 23, 2011 04:12PM smhuse wrote: I forgot to specifically ask about this, but the onco did send me for a chest, abdomen and pelvic CT because of my history.  I will eventually ask at one of my appointments.
Posts.Title: Cervical Cancer related to BC? smhuse smhuse

Posts.Content: smhuse wrote: I am 47 years young and was diagnosed with invasive ductal carcinoma last week.  When I was 26 I was diagosed with IIb cervical cancer and had the CA removed during an outpatient surgery.  A year later I wasn't clear and had to have a hysterectomy (still have my ovaries).  In 2006 I was diagnosed with a neoplasm in my vaginal vault that was removed with surgery.... now the diagnosis of breast cancer.  Are they related?  Since about Dec 2010 I have been having severe upper abdominal bloating with small meals and beverages.  The bloating never seems to go away, just gets worse or gets a little better.  I had an upper GI that showed mild GERD.  I don't think GERD is causing the bloating .  Is any of this related in some manner?     Dx 7/7/2011, IDC, <1cm, Grade 1, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Cervical Cancer related to BC? smhuse smhuse
